member.name: M:System.ArrayEx.GetMultiCombinationEnumerator``1(``0[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Gets an enumerator that traverse through combinations of elements in the current . A combination is a subset of the current array. For example, {1,2,3}, {2,3,4}, etc., are the 3-combinations of integer array {1,2,3,4,5}, while {1,2}, {3,4} are its 2-combinations.

The maximum number of elements of each combination returned by the enumerator if is no larger than ; otherwise, the minimum number of elements of each combination returned by the enumerator.

Limits the number of combinations the returned enumerator can go through. The first element of this array limits the number of returned -combinations, the second element limits the number of returned (+1)-combinations (or (-1)-combinations if is larger than ), and so forth. NOTE that if k-combination has no corresponding return limit, in which case the length of is smaller than k - + 1, then the number of returned k-combinations will not be limited.
For example, if the current array is {1,2,3,4,5}, and is 0, 5, 2, 3, {2,3}, then returned enumerator will go through {1,2}, {1,3}, {1,2,3}, {1,2,4}, {1,2,5}. If is changed to 4, then all 4-combinations {1,2,3,4},{1,2,3,5},{1,2,4,5},{1,3,4,5},{2,3,4,5} will be returned by the enumerator since there is no limit on 4-combinations.
member.returns: An enumerator that traverse through combinations of elements in the current array.

member.name: T:System.DistinctRandomAlgorithms
member.summary: Specifies algorithms to generate distinct random values.

member.name: F:System.DistinctRandomAlgorithms.SimpleHash
member.summary: Simply uses a hashtable to prevent repetition, suitable for generating few distinct random values from a wide range.

member.name: F:System.DistinctRandomAlgorithms.Swap
member.summary: Suits when the ratio of the number of generated random values to the number of all possible values is high (typically higher than 20%) and the latter is not large (typically smaller than 1000).

member.name: F:System.DistinctRandomAlgorithms.SwapHash
member.summary: Suits when the ratio of the number of generated random values to the number of all possible values is high (typically higher than 20%) and the latter is not quite small (typically larger than 1000).

member.name: F:System.DistinctRandomAlgorithms.Auto
member.summary: Let the system determine which algorithm should be applied.

member.name: T:System.Collections.Generic.SinglyLinkedList`1
member.summary: Represents a singly-linked list.
member.typeparam: Specifies the element type of the linked list.
member.remarks:
SinglyLinkedList{T} is a general-purpose singly-linked list. It supports enumerators and implements the interface, consistent with other collection classes in the .NET Framework. In comparison with , which is doubly-linked, this class saves some memory and has slightly higher performance. Each node of this singly-linked list is represented by a , which only points forward to the next node and DOES NOT provide a reference to its attached list like . In other words, each node only has two properties - Value and Next.
Because each node of a does not refer to the attached list, the list does not perform attachment validation when a node is added or removed from the list. In this case, any usage of this singly-linked list must ensure the attachment.

member.name: M:System.Collections.Generic.SinglyLinkedList`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the .
member.returns: A that can be used to iterate through the .
member.remarks: At first the enumerator is positioned before the first node. At this position, Current is undefined. When you first call the MoveNext method, the enumerator move to the first node. After that, the enumerator moves to the next node each time MoveNext is called, until the last node is reached. When the last node is reached after MoveNext is called, the next call of MoveNext will return false.

member.name: T:System.Collections.Generic.SinglyLinkedListNode`1
member.summary: Represents a node in a .
member.typeparam: Specifies the element type of the linked list.
member.remarks: Each element of the collection is a . The contains a value and a reference to the next node. Unlike a , this class does not reference to the previous node and the list it belongs to, which saves 8 Bytes on a machine that uses 32-bit memory architecture (like a x86 machine), and 16 Bytes on a machine that uses 64-bit memory architecture (like a x64 machine).

member.name: T:System.Collections.Generic.MEnumerator`1
member.summary: Supports a simple sequential iteration over multiple generic collections enumerated by their own enumerators. This class can be viewed as an enumerator of enumerators and the initial "M" stands for "multiple", "merged".
member.typeparam: The type of the elements this enumerator enumerates.

member.name: M:System.Collections.Generic.MEnumerator`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator{`0}[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of System.Collections.MEnumerator{T} class.
member.param:
An array of enumerators that enumerate the same type of elements.
Initially, this class sets the first enumerator in this array as the current enumerator. You may advance the current enumerator by MoveNext method. If the current enumerator moves past the last element of the collection it enumerats, then the next one in this array will become the current enumerator.

member.name: P:System.Collections.Generic.MEnumerator`1.Current
member.summary: Gets the current element.

member.name: M:System.Collections.Generic.MEnumerator`1.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:System.Collections.Generic.MEnumerator`1.MoveNext
member.summary:
Advances the enumerator to the next element of the current enumerator.
When this class is initialized, an array of enumerators is passed into the contructor. Initially the first enumerator is the current enumerator and this method advances the current enumerator. When the current enumerator moves past the last element of the collection it enumerates, the next enumerator in the enumerator array will become the current enumerator. If the current enumerator is the last one in the enumerator array, and there is no more elements to enumerate, false will be returned by this method.
member.returns: true if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the last enumerator.

member.name: M:System.Collections.Generic.MEnumerator`1.Reset
member.summary: Sets the the current enumerator to the first enumerator and sets the first enumerator to its initial position, which is before its first element.

member.name: M:System.OptionParser.Parse(System.String[],System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses options from the string arguments.
member.param: The string arguments.

The prefix for the arugment key. The default is "--", so an argument key-value pair specification can be written in format --key value (two argument slots). The argument value can be later retrieved by method. Flags without arugment values can be set using --flag --key value (the first argument is a flag named "flag", and the second argument is a key-value pair), where the existence of the flag can be determined later by method.
The surfix for the argument key. The default is ":", so an argument key-value pair specification can be written in format "key=value" (one argument slot). A flag can be set using falg="".
true if unspecified required argument
member.returns: An storing the parsed arguments.
member.remarks:
Three styles of argument specification are supported. Different styles can be mixed.
--key value Occupies two argument slots. The '--' key prefix can be replaced by a customized prefix specified by . The value can be retrieved by method from the returned object. To specify a flag, simply skip the value. For example, cmd --flag1 --flag2 --arg value specifies two flags 'flag1' and 'flag2' and one argument with key 'arg'.
key=value Occupies one argument slot. The '=' key surfix can be replaced by a customized prefix specified by . The value can be retrieved by method from the returned object. To specify a flag, make the value empty. For example, cmd flag1= flag2= --arg value specifies two flags 'flag1' and 'flag2' and one argument with key 'arg'. This is also an exmaple that two styles of argument specification can be mixed.
unkeyed argument Unkeyed arguments are matched with unspecified required arguments in order. For example, suppose we define two required arguments "arg1", "arg2" and "arg3", then cmd --arg2 value2 value1 has one keyed argument "arg2" with its value being "value2"; and "value1" is an unkeyed argument that will be assigned to "arg1", because "arg1" is the first unspecified argument.

member.name: T:System.IO.Compression.ByteCompressionMethods
member.summary: Representing compression algorithms.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.ByteCompressionMethods.None
member.summary: No compression algorithm is used. The original data will be returned.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.ByteCompressionMethods.GZipOptimal
member.summary: Uses GZip algorithm and performs an optimal compression.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.ByteCompressionMethods.DeflateOptimal
member.summary: Uses Deflate algorithm and performs an optimal compression.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.ByteCompressionMethods.GZipFast
member.summary: Uses GZip algorithm and performs a fast compression.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.ByteCompressionMethods.DeflateFast
member.summary: Uses Deflate algorithm and performs a fast compression.

member.name: T:System.IO.Compression.CompressionEx
member.summary: Provides methods to easily compress byte arrays.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.CompressionEx.Compress(System.Byte[],System.IO.Compression.ByteCompressionMethods@)
member.summary: Compresses a byte array using a specified algorithm.
member.param: The byte array to compress.

The algorithm used to compress the array. This method will check the compression rate after the compression is done, and if it is not smaller than 1 (indicating the "compressed" data takes even more space than the original data and the compression is ineffective), the original data will be returned and this argument will be set ByteCompressionMethods.None.
member.returns: The compressed byte array if the compression is successful; or the original bytes if the compression is ineffective.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.CompressionEx.Compress(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.IO.Compression.ByteCompressionMethods@)
member.summary: Compresses a byte array using a specified algorithm.
member.param: The byte array to compress.
The zero-based position in the array where the compression begins.

The algorithm used to compress the array. This method will check the compression rate after the compression is done, and if it is not smaller than 1 (indicating the "compressed" data takes even more space than the original data and the compression is ineffective), the original data will be returned and this argument will be set ByteCompressionMethods.None.
member.returns: The compressed byte array if the compression is successful; or the bytes in the original byte array from to the end if the compression is ineffective.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.CompressionEx.DeCompress(System.Byte[],System.IO.Compression.ByteCompressionMethods)
member.summary: Decompresses a byte array using a specified algorithm.
member.param: The byte array to decompress.
The algorithm used to decompress the array.
member.returns: The decompressed byte array.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.CompressionEx.DeCompress(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.IO.Compression.ByteCompressionMethods)
member.summary: Decompresses a byte array using a specified algorithm.
member.param: The byte array to decompress.
The zero-based position in the array where the decompression begins.
The algorithm used to decompress the array.
member.returns: The decompressed byte array.

member.name: T:System.IO.FileStreamCollection`1
member.summary: Provides a collection class that simplifies management of a variety of file streams.
member.typeparam:
The type of dictionary used to store and retrieve file streams. This dictionary must use strings as keys and accept System.IO.FileStream objects as values.
You will retrieve each file stream by its ID (as a key in the dictionary).

member.name: P:System.IO.FileStreamCollection`1.Mode
member.summary: Gets a value indicating how the operating system should open a file for every file stream in this collection.

member.name: P:System.IO.FileStreamCollection`1.Access
member.summary: Gets a value indicating how the operating system should access a file for every file stream in this collection.

member.name: P:System.IO.FileStreamCollection`1.Share
member.summary: Gets a value indicating what kind of access all file streams can have to a file at the same time.

member.name: T:System.IO.FRecordStream
member.summary: A forward-only stream that allows storing records of indefinite size on the same base stream. Overhead is remarkably lower than a similar class .
member.remarks: This class allocate blocks of variable length to store data and works much like a forward-only linked list. In this sense backward-seeking is not supported by this class. A similar class always allocates blocks of the same length and is able to seek back and forth. However, two methods SaveStatus and RestoreStatus are provided to alleviate this drawback. Also note that the memory usage of each instance of this class is fixed, with contrast to which uses more memory when new blocks are created.

member.param: A where data are actually stored.

Specifies the minimum size in bytes of a data block.
Specifies how many bytes are enough to describe the size of a data block. For example, if the maximum size of a data block is 64KB, then 2 bytes are sufficient.
Specifies how many bytes are enough to describe the total size of data. For example, if the maximum size of all data is 4GB, then 4 bytes are sufficient.
member.exception: is null.
must be seekable, readable and writable.

member.name: M:System.IO.FRecordStream.SaveStatus(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Preserves the current status (especially data position) of this . The current status is temporarily stored and will be discarded by UnloadInfo method.
!!! This method is invalid if necessary meta information has not been loaded. In this case, call LoadInfo method first.
!!! This method is invalid if there currently exists no data block in this instance. Call Reset method instead of saving the initial position by this method.

exception.para: Necessary meta information has not been loaded and you need to call LoadInfo method first;
or you call this method when the current is empty.

member.name: M:System.IO.FRecordStream.RestoreStatus(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Restores this to its previous status.
!!! This method is invalid if necessary meta information has not been loaded. In this case, call LoadInfo method first.
member.exception: Necessary meta information has not been loaded and you need to call LoadInfo method first;

member.name: P:System.IO.FRecordStream.CanRead
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this stream supports reading. true always.

member.name: P:System.IO.FRecordStream.CanSeek
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether this stream supports seeking. true always.

member.name: P:System.IO.FRecordStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this stream supports writing. true always.

member.name: M:System.IO.FRecordStream.Alloc(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Allocates new space in the underlying stream to store more data.
** It is not necessary to call this method when avaialbe space is not sufficient since new space will be automatically assigned. This method provies a way to manually request space.
!!! This method is invalid if necessary meta information has not been loaded. In this case, call LoadInfo method first.
member.exception: Necessary meta information has not been loaded and you need to call LoadInfo method first;

member.name: M:System.IO.FRecordStream.Reset
member.summary: Goes to the beginning of this .

member.name: M:System.IO.FRecordStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
!!! This method is invalid if necessary meta information has not been loaded. In this case, call LoadInfo method first.
!!! This method is invalid if there currently exists no data block in this instance. Writes some data first.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

exception.para: Necessary meta information has not been loaded and you need to call LoadInfo method first;
or you call this method when the current is empty.

member.name: M:System.IO.FRecordStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
!!! This method is invalid if necessary meta information has not been loaded. In this case, call LoadInfo method first.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.name: P:System.IO.FRecordStream.Empty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current is empty and no data block has been created.

member.name: M:System.IO.FRecordStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary:
Sets the position within the current stream. This method is limited in the following ways, 1. only Current is valid for ; 2. backward seeking (negative ) is only allowed within the current data block.
!!! This method is invalid if necessary meta information has not been loaded. In this case, call LoadInfo method first.
!!! This method is invalid if there currently exists no data block in this instance. Writes some data first.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.

A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
!!! For , only Current is valid.

exception.para: Necessary meta information has not been loaded and you need to call LoadInfo method first;
or you call this method when the current is empty.

member.summary: Goes to the end of this .

member.name: M:System.IO.FRecordStream.LoadInfo
member.summary:
Loads necessary information before further operations.

member.name: M:System.IO.FRecordStream.SaveInfo
member.summary: Permanently saves the current status of this . Note that this method remembers the current position which will be restored the next time LoadInfo is called.

member.name: M:System.IO.FRecordStream.UnloadInfo
member.summary:
Permanently preserves the current status of this and unloads some information to save memory. This method put this into a status where most operations are invalid. You need to call LoadInfo again.
!!! All temporary status stored by SaveStatus method will be discarded.

member.name: M:System.IO.IBasicRecord.LoadInfo
member.summary: Loads the section information of this record. This method should presume the info-stream is not at the right position (i.e. call SeekTo method befor reading) and should NOT wind the stream back where it was right before the reading started.

member.name: M:System.IO.IBasicRecord.SaveInfo
member.summary: Saves the section information of this record. This method should presume the info-stream is not at the right position (i.e. call SeekTo method befor writing) and should NOT wind the stream back where it was right before the saving started.

member.name: M:System.IO.IBasicRecord.UnloadInfo
member.summary: Unloads section information of this record. The section information should be able to be loaded again later. Once the section information is unloaded, this record should not be readable before the LoadInfo method is called.

member.name: P:System.IO.IBasicRecord.InfoStream
member.summary: Gets or sets the stream where the section information is stored. This property is meant to be used in the code of class implementing this interface. ANY class implementing this interface SHOULD NOT publicly expose this property. Be CAREFULL with the existing data in this stream if you have to tamper with them. If the section information is corrupted, all the data will be lost.

member.name: P:System.IO.IBasicRecord.DataStream
member.summary: Gets or sets the stream where the data is stored. This property is meant to be used in the code of class implementing this interface. ANY class implementing this interface SHOULD NOT publicly expose this property. Be CAREFULL with the existing data in this stream if you have to tamper with them.

member.name: P:System.IO.IBasicRecord.InfoPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position where the section information is stored in the info-stream. This property is meant to be used in the code of class implementing this interface. ANY class implementing this interface SHOULD NOT publicly expose this property.

member.name: M:System.IO.IBasicRecord.Clear
member.summary: Removes all the data in this record.

member.name: M:System.IO.RecordStream.CreateNew(System.Int32)
member.summary: Makes this represent a new record without eliminating the data of the previous record in the underlying stream. If you have already loaded an existing record into this instance and made changes to the data blocks, and you call this method again before you call SaveInfo, and then these new changes will be lost.
member.param: The length of each data block in this record stream.

member.name: P:System.IO.RecordStream.Initialized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this record stream is initialized. If not, you should call method CreatNew before writing any data to this stream.

member.name: P:System.IO.RecordStream.MetaNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit integer in this record stream. This number is stored in this stream but can be retrieved without first calling the LoadInfo method. Note that after assigning a value to this property, you still need to call SaveInfo to save the change.

member.name: M:System.IO.RecordStream.ReadMetaNumber
member.summary: Reads the meta number from this record stream. This method only reads from the stream but does not change the current value of MetaNumber property.
member.returns: The meta number stored in this stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.RecordStream.LoadInfo
member.summary: Loads meta information into this instance of . If you have called UnloadInfo, the status of this instance will be restored where it was right before the last time UnloadInfo was called.

member.name: P:System.IO.RecordStream.StartPosition
member.summary: Gets the position of meta information in the info stream or base stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.RecordStream.SaveInfo
member.summary: Saves meta information of this instance. This method only saves the information of new data blocks whereby the new data will be meanwhile preserved. However, it has nothing to do with the changes you made on the old data blocks, on which any modification will be immediately effective no matter whether you call this method or not.

member.name: M:System.IO.RecordStream.UnloadInfo
member.summary: Unloads the meta information of this instance and release some memory. Before calling this method, you must make a decision to save or discard the changes to the data blocks. Later you are able to reload the meta information by calling LoadInfo again.

member.name: M:System.IO.RecordStream.DiscardUpdate
member.summary: Marks all new data blocks since the last time SaveInfo was called as discarded. Note that this method only discards new blocks whereby the data on the new blocks will also be discarded. However, changes on the old data blocks will not be affected. This method only marks the new data blocks as discarded but not really deletes them. You can call ResumeUpdate to reverse this operation. Also, this operation will be reversed automatically if any new writing occurs.

member.name: M:System.IO.RecordStream.ResumeUpdate
member.summary: Resumes the data blocks previously marked as discarded.

member.name: M:System.IO.RecordStream.Clear
member.summary: Clears all the data in this record stream and frees all the space taken if this record has a manager. If this record has a manager, the clearance will be immediately effective and the data is no longer recoverable. If not, you are allowed to sequentially call DiscardUpdate, UnloadInfo and LoadInfo to resume all cleared data.

The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.

member.summary:

Each line of text in the file represents a dictionary entry. Each line is first split by the specified into a string array; The first element in the array is used as the key, while the remaining elements are converted as values associated with the key.

member.name: M:System.IO.StreamEx.WriteToFile(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Reads the bytes from the current stream and writes them to a file. Copying begins at the current position in the current stream, and does not reset the position of the current stream after the writing is complete. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten.

The path of the file to write.

member.name: M:System.IO.StreamEx.ReadFromFile(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Reads the bytes from a file and writes them into this stream at its current position. After reading, the position of the current stream is not reset and remains where it is.
member.param: A .
The path of the file to read.

The System.UInt64 value.

member.name: M:System.IO.StreamEx.WriteSByteArray(System.IO.Stream,System.SByte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes an array of System.SByte integers to the current stream. You may write an empty array or a null reference.
member.param: The stream to write.
The byte array to write.
Indicates whether to write a check code before the byte array. This check code will help detect corrupted data.
member.returns: The number of bytes actually written to the stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.StreamEx.WriteSByteArray(System.IO.Stream,System.SByte[],System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes an array of System.SByte integers to the current stream using the specified buffer. You may write an empty array or a null reference.
member.param: The stream to write.
The byte array to write.
Indicates whether to write a check code before the byte array. This check code will help detect corrupted data.
A byte array used to temporarily store data to write.
member.returns: The number of bytes actually written to the stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.StreamEx.ReadSByteArray(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads a System.SByte integer array from this stream. The method does not require an argument specifying the length of the array; .
member.param: The stream to read.
Set this parameter true if there is a check code before the array to prevent data corruption; otherwise, set this false.
member.returns: The System.SByte array read from the stream.
member.exception: Raises if data in the stream is corrupted.

member.name: M:System.IO.StreamEx.ReadSByteArray(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads a System.SByte integer array from this stream. The method does not require an argument specifying the length of the array; .
member.param: The stream to read.
Set this parameter true if there is a check code before the array to prevent data corruption; otherwise, set this false.
A byte array used to temporarily store data read from the stream.
member.returns: The System.SByte array read from the stream.
member.exception: Raises if data in the stream is corrupted.

member.name: M:System.IO.StreamEx.ReadSByteArrayToBuffer(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads a System.SByte integer array from this stream into the specified buffer. This method avoids an additional data copy to enchance performance.
member.param: The stream to read.
Set this parameter true if there is a check code before the array to prevent data corruption; otherwise, set this false.
A byte array used to store data read from the stream. You may later get a SByte pointer of this array for fast iteration.
member.returns: true if the array read from the stream is not empty; otherwise, false.
member.exception: Raises if data in the stream is corrupted.

member.name: M:System.IO.StreamEx.WriteDict(System.IO.Stream,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Byte,System.Byte},System.Boolean)

true if a 8-byte code is written to the stream before all actual data. When the dictionary is later read from the stream, this code should be at the reading start position, or otherwise the data in the stream is corrupted.

Supports simple iteration of substrings in a string instance. For example, suppose "<" and ">" are used as the indicators, iterating "
abc
" will get "
" and "
"

member.name: P:System.StringEnumerator1.Current
member.summary: Gets the current substring.

member.name: P:System.StringEnumerator1.StartPosition
member.summary: Gets the position of the current substring in the original string.

member.name: P:System.StringEnumerator1.EndPosition
member.summary: Gets the end position of the current substring in the original string.

member.name: P:System.StringEnumerator1.StartIndicator
member.summary: Gets the indicator makring the beginning of each substring to iterate.

member.name: P:System.StringEnumerator1.EndIndicator
member.summary: Gets the indicator makring the end of each substring to iterate.

member.name: P:System.StringEnumerator1.EndOfString
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the end of the original string is reached.

member.name: M:System.StringEnumerator1.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next desired substring.
member.returns: true if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next substring; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the original string.

member.name: M:System.StringEnumerator1.Reset
member.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the beginning of the original string.

member.name: M:System.StringEnumerator1.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes this enumerator.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.IsNullOrEmpty(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if current string instance is null or empty. This is a dummy of method for convenience.
member.param: This string instance.
member.returns: true if this string instance is null or empty; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns true if the current string instance is empty.

member.returns: true if the current string is empty; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Indicates whether the current string instance is empty or contains only whitespace characters defined by .

member.exception: Occurs when is a null reference.

member.summary: Gets an object that can iterate through substrings in this string instance (or a part of this string according to and ) that are delimited by Unicode characters satisfying the specified predicate.
member.param: This string instance.
A function to test each Unicode character of the current string. Any character that passes this test will be used as a separator.
The zero-based position indicating where the search for separators starts.
A positive value indicating the number of characters to search starting from the position specified by .
true if the returned enumerator should ignore empty substrings; otherwise false.
true if the separator should be included in each substring returned by the enumerator; otherwise, false.
member.returns: An object that can iterate through substrings in the current string instance (or a part of the current string instance) that are delimited by Unicode characters satisfying the specified predicate.

member.summary: Gets an object that can iterate through information about substrings in this string instance (or a part of the current string instance according to and ) that are delimited by Unicode characters satisfying the specified predicate.

A function used to test each Unicode character of the current string. If a character passes this predicate, it returns a non-negative integer as the separator's index; otherwise, this function must return -1. Any character satisfying this predicate will be used as the separator.

true if the returned enumerator should ignore empty substrings; otherwise false.
member.returns: An object that can iterate through information about substrings in the current string instance (or a part of the current string instance) that are delimited by Unicode characters satisfying the specified predicate.

member.summary: Gets an object that can iterate through groups of substrings in this string instance (or a part of the current string instance according to and ) that are delimited by Unicode characters satisfying the specified primary predicate and secondary predicate.
member.param: This string instance.

A function used to test each Unicode character of the current string. If a character passes this predicate, it returns a non-negative integer as the separator's index; otherwise, this function must return -1. Any character satisfying this predicate will be used as the primary separator. A primary spearator delimits substring arrays, for example, in "123,456;abc,def" which represent substring arrays { {"123", "456"}, {"abc", "def"} }, the semi-comma ';' is the primary separator.

A function used to test each Unicode character of the current string. If a character passes this predicate, it returns a non-negative integer as the separator's index; otherwise, this function must return -1. Any character satisfying this predicate will be used as the secondary separator. A secondary separator delimits substrings in an array, for example, in "123,456;abc,def" which represent substring arrays { {"123", "456"}, {"abc", "def"} }, the comma ',' is the secondary separator.
The zero-based position indicating where the search for separators starts.
A positive value indicating the number of characters to search starting from the position specified by .
true if the returned enumerator should ignore empty substrings; otherwise false.
member.returns: An object that can iterate through groups of substrings in this string instance (or a part of the current string instance) that are delimited by Unicode characters satisfying the specified two predicates.

A function used to test each Unicode character of the current string. member.name: M:System.StringEx.GetComboEnumerator(System.String,System.Char,System.Char,System.Char,System.Char,System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Gets an enumerator that can iterate through certain combinations of strings specified in this combination expression.
member.param: A combination expression to indicate what strings are used for combination and how they are combined.
A Unicode character used as the separator to delimit different types of arguments.
A Unicode character used as the separator to delimit different arguments of the same type.
A Unicode character right paired by the to bracket the argument part.
A Unicode character left paired by the to bracket the argument part.
A Unicode character right paired by the to escape and .
A Unicode character left paired by the to escape and .
member.returns: An enumerator object that can be used to iterate through combinations of strings specified in the .
member.remarks:
A combination expression consists of two parts, the combination method and the bracketed argument part, which looks like "point(1,2,3)", where "point" is the combination method and "1,2,3" inside a pair of round brackets is the argument.
Three types of combination methods are supported.
cube the returned enumerator will go through all combitnations of the keywords if no argument is provided, for example, the enumerator generated by "cube(1,2,3)" will enum {1}, {2}, {3}, {1,2}, {1,3}, {2,3}, {1,2,3} in order. This method can also go through combinations according to the argument and it is the only method that accepts the depth and the count argument indicating what combinations the enumerator can go through. This method also supports the randomness argument. square the returned enumerator will go through every single keyword and every 2-gram combination. For example, the enumerator generated by "square(1,2,3)" will enum {1}, {2}, {3}, {1,2}, {1,3}, {2,3} in order. This method only supports the randomness argument. point the returned enumerator will only go through every single keyword. For example, the enumerator generated by "square(1,2,3)" will enum {1}, {2}, {3} in order. This method only supports the randomness argument.
The cube method supports three types of argument besides the keywords.
depth indicating the minimum and the maximum length of each combination. For example, cube(a,b,c; 2) returns {a,b}, {a,c} and {b,c}, for the depth argument "2" indicates only 2-gram combinations should be returned. There can be more than one depth argument and one depth can overlap the other, for example, cube(a,b,c; 2-3,1-2) will return {a,b}, {a,c}, {b,c}, {a,b,c}, {a}, {b}, {c}, {a,b}, {a,c} and {b,c}. count indicating how many combinations are returned for each depth argument. For example, cube(a,b,c; 2; 1) only returns {a,b}, for the count argument "1" indicates only one 2-gram combination should be returned. For another example, cube(a,b,c; 2-3,1-2; 2,3) will return {a,b}, {a,c}, {a}, {b}, {c}, because the count arguments indicate the enumerator should go through only two combinations for depth 2-3, and threee combinations for depth 1-2. randomness all three methods, cube, squre and point. Currently you can specify "static" and "random" for this argument. If "static" is specified, the combinations will come out in sequence, as demonstrated by all above examples; if "random" is specified, the order of the combinations will be randomized, for example, "point(a,b,c; random)" might return {b}, {c}, {a}, and might also return {a}, {c}, {b}.
NOTE that the depth arguments and the count arguments are optional, and expressions like "cube(a,b,c; random)", "cube(a,b,c; 1-2; random)" are valid. Also NOTE that if the depth arguments are not specified, then the count arguments should not be used, for the count argument correspond to the depth arguments.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.GetKeyValuePairEnumerator(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Char,System.Char,System.Char,System.Char,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an enumerator that iterates through key/value pairs represented by this string instance (or a substring of it), if this string follows certain syntax.
member.param: This string instance.
Specifies where the representation of key/value pairs starts.
Specifies the length of the representation.
The Unicode character that delimits key and value in each pair. In each pair, only the first character that equals this argument will be recognized as a delimiter, and it cannot be escaped.
The Unicode character that delimits key/value pairs. This delimiter is escapable.
The Unicode character as the left escape quote for . Use '\0' to indicate the escape is disabled and all three argument , and are ineffective.
The Unicode character as the right escape quote for .
true if the white spaces at both ends of the value of each returned pair is trimmed; otherwise, false.
member.returns: An enumerator that iterates through key/value pairs represented by this string instance.
member.remarks: This string must follow the syntax "(<key> <keyDelimiter> <leftQuote>?<value> <pairDelimiter><rightQuote>?) (...n)" If the is ';' (default value) and the escape is disabled, this string must follow the syntax "(<key> = <value>;) (...n)" which is exactly the same as a standard database connection string.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.IndexOfNextMatch(System.String,System.Char,System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reports the zero-based index of the next character which matches another specified character. Those matched characters are usually brackets, such as '(' and ')', '[' and ']', '{' and '}'.
member.param: This string instance.
The character that matches the character to search, typically a left bracket, such as '(', '[' or '{', or quotes, such as '"', '''.
The character to search, typically a right bracket, such as ')', ']' or '}', or quotes, such as '"', '''.

The search starting position. NOTE that this position should be right at the you want to find a match for. For example, if it is intended to find a match of the first left square bracket at position 0 in string "[abc[de]fgh]", the should be 0.
A positive value indicating the number of characters to search starting from the position specified by .
member.returns: The zero-based index position of if that character is found and it matches , or -1 if it is not.

The next character to search, typically a right bracket, such as ')', ']' or '}'.
Specifies the left quote. Any character inside quotes ( and ) will not be considered as a match.
Specifies the right quote. Any character inside quotes ( and ) will not be considered as a match.

Specifies an array of Unicode characters as the left quotes. A left quote of an index of this array corresponds to the right quote of that index of the array specified by . Any character that appears between a left quote and its corresponding right quote will not be considered a match.

Specifies an array of Unicode characters as the right quotes. A right quote of an index of this array corresponds to the left quote of that index of the array specified by . Any character that appears between a left quote and its corresponding right quote will not be considered a match.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.IndexOfNextMatch(System.String,System.Char,System.Char,System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reports the zero-based index of the next character which matches another specified character. The method supports classic escaping. Those matched characters are usually brackets, such as '(' and ')', '[' and ']', '{' and '}'.
member.param: This string instance.
The character that matches the character to search, typically a left bracket, such as '(', '[' or '{'.
The next character to search, typically a right bracket, such as ')', ']' or '}'.

The character that escapes the , typically '\'. For example, suppose '\' is used for escaping, then the match for the first left square bracket in string "[abc\]abc]" is the last right square bracket, not the one in the middle because the '\' that precedes it escapes it.

The search starting position. NOTE that this position should be right at the you want to find a match for. For example, if it is intended to find a match of the first left square bracket at position 0 in string "[abc[de]fgh]", the should be 0.
The number of characters to search. The parameter determines the search ending position along with .
member.returns: The zero-based index position of if that character is found and it matches , or -1 if it is not.

The next character to search, typically a right bracket, such as ')', ']' or '}'.

The characters that escape the , typically '\'. For example, suppose '\', '#' are used for escaping, then the match for the first left square bracket in string "[abc\]#]abc]" is the last right square bracket, not the two in the middle because the '\' and '#' that precede them escapes them respectively.

The number of characters to search. The parameter determines the search ending position along with .
member.returns: The zero-based index position of if that character is found and it matches , or -1 if it is not.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.BiSplit(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary:
Splits this string into two substrings at the position where the first occurrence of is found.
This is a useful method when splitting an attribute-value string like "company: Microsoft".
member.param: This string instance.
A character as the separator. NOTE that this separator will be removed. For example, split "abcde" by "c" and we will get "ab" and "de".
member.returns: A pair of split substrings if the separator is found; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.BiSplit(System.String,System.Char,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary:

If is found, returns the substring from beginning to the position before , where is returned if the leading character of the current string equals the ; otherwise, null.
If is found, returns the substring from the position after to the end; otherwise, null.
member.returns: true if is found in the current string; otherwise, false.

A character as the separator. NOTE that this separator will be removed. For example, split "abcde" by "c" and we will get "ab" and "de".

members.member:
Returns a array that contains information about the substrings in this string (or a part of this string according to ) that are delimited by specified Unicode characters.
This string instance. A non-empty array of Unicode characters that delimit the substrings in the current string instance. The zero-based position indicating where the search for separators starts. true if empty strings should be removed from the returned substrings; otherwise false. Indicates whether the returned substrings are trimmed.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.ContainsAllSequentially(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Determines whether this string instance contains all the specified strings sequentially.
** The difference between this method and ContainsAll is how the target values should occur. For example, string "ab, ef, cd" contains "ab", "cd" and "ef" but does not contain "ab", "cd" and "ef" sequentially.
member.param: This string instance.
The strings to seek.
Indicating the zero-based position where the search starts.
member.returns: true if this string contains all the specified strings sequentially; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.Retrieve(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.StringRetrievalOption[])
member.summary:
Retrieves substrings represented by System.Substring objects from this string instance. The search proceeds accroding to the indicators in the System.RetrieveOption objects.
This method first retrieves the an array of substrings according to the indicators in the first System.RetrieveOption object. If the previous search ends at position p1, then this method continutes to retrieve the second array of substrings according to the indicators in the second System.RetrieveOption object, starting from the postion p1.
member.param: This string instance.
Indicating the position where the search starts.
The search starts after the first occurrence of this string instance after the start position.
The search ends at the first occurrence of this string instance.
An array of System.RetrieveOption objects that store search indicators.
member.returns: The retrieved substrings represented by System.Substring objects.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.Decorate(System.String,System.Char,System.Int32,System.HorizontalAlignment,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Decorates this string with the repetition of specified characters.
For example, decorating "abc" as "--abc---" when using "-" as the decoration character, or as " abc " when using a space as the decoration character.
member.param: A System.String object.
The decoration character.
The total length of the string plus the decoration.
The alignment of this string.
A positive integer indicates this string moves rightward; a negative integer indicates moving leftward.
Indicates whether the decoration at the right side can be longer than the other side when it is not possible to make them even.
member.returns: A string with decoration.

remarks.para: Usage: this method could be useful in console applications or other scenarios to output aligned texts.
Test: this method has been tested, but is not guaranteed bug-free.
Future: future versions could use unsafe coding to improve performance.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.Decorate(System.String,System.Char,System.Char,System.Int32,System.HorizontalAlignment,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Decorates this string with the repetition of specified characters.
For example, decorating "abc" as "--abc***" when using "-" as the decoration character at the left side and "*" at the right side, or as " abc " when using a space as the decoration character at both sides.
member.param: A System.String object.
The decoration character at the left side.
The decoration character at the right side.
The total length of the string plus the decoration.
The alignment of this string.
A positive integer indicates this string moves rightward; a negative integer indicates moving leftward.
Indicates whether the decoration at the right side can be longer than the other side when it is not possible to make them even.
member.returns: A string with decoration.

remarks.para: Usage: this method could be useful in console applications or other scenarios to output aligned texts.
Test: this method has been tested, but is not guaranteed bug-free.
Future: future versions could use unsafe coding to improve performance.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.HexEncode(System.String,System.Text.Encoding,System.Char)
member.summary:
Encodes non-ASCII chars in this string by their equivalent hex representations.
** Particularly used in translating url containing non-ASCII chars to an ASCII url. For example, "http://www.hudong.com/wiki/" will be translated to "http://www.hudong.com/wiki/%E7%94%B5%E5%AD%90%E5%9E%83%E5%9C%BE".
member.param: This string instance.
Specifies the encoding for encoding the non-ASCII chars.
Specifies the char before each hex representation of a byte value.
member.returns: A copy of the original string with all non-ASCII chars and the chars in the exception list converted to hex representations.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.HexEncode(System.String,System.Text.Encoding,System.Char[],System.Char)
member.summary:
Encodes non-ASCII chars in this string by their equivalent hex representations. For example, "http://www.hudong.com/wiki/" will be translated to "http://www.hudong.com/wiki/%E7%94%B5%E5%AD%90%E5%9E%83%E5%9C%BE".
** Particularly used in translating url containing non-ASCII chars to an ASCII url.
member.param: This string instance.
Specifies the encoding for encoding the non-ASCII chars.
Specifies the ASCII chars that are also converted to hex representations.
Specifies the char before each hex representation of a byte value.
member.returns: A copy of the original string with all non-ASCII chars and the chars in the exception list converted to hex representations.

member.name: M:System.StringEx.HexDecode(System.String,System.Text.Encoding,System.Char)

member.param: This string instance.

member.returns: A copy of the original string with hex representations decoded to their equivalent chars.

member.name: T:System.MultipleStringSearch
member.summary:
Provides methods (Aho-Corasick algorithm) to search occurrences of multiple keywords. These methods are most efficient when there are many short keywords distinguishable by the beginning few characters.
NOTE this class does not support case-insensitive or culture-sensitive search. To perform case-insensitive search, you may first lower-case both the keywords and the target text.

member.summary: Initialize tree node with specified character
member.param: Parent node
Character

member.summary: Adds pattern ending in this node
member.param: Pattern

member.name: M:System.MultipleStringSearch.InnerNode.AddTransition(System.MultipleStringSearch.InnerNode)
member.summary: Adds transition node
member.param: Node

member.name: M:System.MultipleStringSearch.InnerNode.GetTransition(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns transition to specified character (if exists)
member.param: Character
member.returns: Returns TreeNode or null

member.name: M:System.MultipleStringSearch.InnerNode.ContainsTransition(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if node contains transition to specified character
member.param: Character
member.returns: True if transition exists

member.name: M:System.MultipleStringSearch.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The keywords.

member.name: M:System.MultipleStringSearch.FindAll(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the specified text and returns all occurrences of any keyword.
member.param: The text to search.
The search starting position.
member.returns: An array of objects that store the search result; null if the search fails.

member.summary: Searches the specified text and returns the first occurrence of any keyword.
member.param: The text to search.
The search starting position.
member.returns: A object that stores the search result; null if the search fails.

member.name: M:System.MultipleStringSearch.ContainsAny(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the specified text and determines if it contains any occurrence of any keyword.
member.param: The text to search.
The search starting position.
member.returns: true if the text searched contains any occurrence of any keyword; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:System.IndexOfAllMode
member.summary: Specifies how to perform the IndexOfAll method.

member.name: F:System.IndexOfAllMode.Normal
member.summary:
Returns the indexes of the first occurrences of all target strings.
For example, searching "a", "b", "c" in "babaca" will return 1, 0, 4.

member.name: F:System.IndexOfAllMode.Sequential
member.summary:
Linearly searches the original string and returns the indexes of the first occurrences of target strings sequentially.
For example, searching "a", "b", "c" in "babaca" will return 1, 2, 4.

Indicates whether to create a new stirng instance.
If set true, the substring will be copied to a new string instance; otherwise, only start and end positions are recorded in this object. By default, this value is set true.
If you are intended to operate on a large amount of substrings, set this value to false to save time and system memory.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.GetKeyValuePairEnumerator(System.Char,System.Char,System.Char,System.Char,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an enumerator that iterates through key/value pairs represented by this if its reading scope follows certain syntax.
member.param: The Unicode character that delimits key and value in each pair. In each pair, only the first character that equals this argument will be recognized as a delimiter, and it cannot be escaped.
The Unicode character that delimits key/value pairs. This delimiter is escapable.
The Unicode character as the left escaping quote for . Use '\0' to indicate the escape is disabled.
The Unicode character as the right escape quote for .
true if the white spaces at both ends of the value of each returned pair is trimmed; otherwise, false.
member.returns: An enumerator that iterates through key/value pairs represented by this .
member.remarks:
To parse the current reading scope as key/value pairs, the reading scope must follow the syntax (<key> <key/value delimiter> [<left escaping quote>]<value> <pair delimiter>[<right escaping quote>]) (...n).
If the is ';' (default value) and the escape is disabled, this string must follow the syntax (<key> = <value>;) (...n), which is exactly the same as a standard database connection string.

member.remarks:
To parse the current reading scope as key/value pairs, the reading scope must follow the syntax (<key> <key/value delimiter> [<left escaping quote>]<value> <pair delimiter>[<right escaping quote>]) (...n).
If the is ';' (default value) and the escape is disabled, this string must follow the syntax (<key> = <value>;) (...n), which is exactly the same as a standard database connection string.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.ReadTo(System.Func{System.Char,System.Boolean},System.Text.StringReader.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Advances the reader and reads until a character satisfying is encountered. The reader's position after executing this method depends on the .
member.param: A method to test each character.
Specifies the reading options.
member.returns:
If ReadeOptions.ReadToEnd is specified in , then a substring starting from the current position of the underlying string instance to the position of the first character satisfying the within the search scope when such character is found, or a substring starting from the current position of the underlying string instance to the end of the search scope if such character is not found.
If ReadeOptions.ReadToEnd is not specified, then a substring starting from the current position of the underlying string instance to the position of the first character satisfying the within the search scope when such character is found, or null if such character is not found.
The position of this reader after executing this method depends on if ReadOptions.StopAfterKey" is specified. If ReadOptions.StopAfterKey" is specified, then the character satisfying the is included in the returned substring if ReadOptions.DiscardKey is also selected.
NOTE that the white spaces at the beginning of the substring will be trimmed if ReadeOptions.TrimStart is specified, and the white spaces at the end of the substring will be trimmed if ReadeOptions.TrimEnd is specified. Also NOTE that will be returned if the length of the substring after trim is 0.

member.param: The reader stops when this character is encountered.
true if the reader should read to the end of the reading scope if the is not found; otherwise, false.
member.returns:
If is true, then a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the position of the first occurrence of the within the search scope when such character is found, or a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the end of the search scope if such character is not found.
If is false, then a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the position of the first occurrence of the within the search scope when such character is found, or null if such character is not found.
NOTE that will be returned if the length of the substring is 0.

The position of this reader after executing this method depends on if is specified. If is specified, then the is included in the returned substring if is also selected.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.ReadTo(System.Char,System.Char[],System.Char[],System.Text.StringReader.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Advances the reader and reads until a character specified by is encountered outside quotes. The reader's position after executing this method depends on the .
member.param: The reader stops when this character is encountered.

An array of Unicode characters as the left quotes. A left quote of an index of this array corresponds to the right quote of that index of the array specified by . The reader will not stop when an is encountered inside a pair of quotes.

An array of Unicode characters as the right quotes. A right quote of an index of this array corresponds to the left quote of that index of the array specified by . The reader will not stop when an is encountered inside a pair of quotes.
Specifies the reading options.
member.returns:
If ReadeOptions.ReadToEnd is specified in , then a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the position of the first occurrence of the within the search scope when such character is found outside quotes, or a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the end of the search scope if such character is not found outside quotes.
If ReadeOptions.ReadToEnd is not specified, then a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the position of the first occurrence of the within the search scope when such character is found outside quotes, or null if such character is not found outside quotes.
The position of this reader after executing this method depends on if ReadOptions.StopAfterKey is specified. If ReadOptions.StopAfterKey is specified, then the character satisfying the is included in the returned substring if ReadOptions.DiscardKey is also selected.
NOTE that the white spaces at the beginning of the substring will be trimmed if ReadeOptions.TrimStart is specified, and the white spaces at the end of the substring will be trimmed if ReadeOptions.TrimEnd is specified. Also NOTE that will be returned if the length of the substring after trim is 0.

member.param: The reader stops when any of these characters is encountered.
The left quote. The reader will not stop when any of the is encountered inside a pair of quotes.
The right quote. The reader will not stop when any of the is encountered inside a pair of quotes.
Returns the index of the encountered keychar in the .
true if the encountered keychar will be discarded and not be included in the returned substring; otherwise, false.
true if the reader should read to the end of the reading scope if none of the is not found; otherwise, false.
member.returns:
If is true, then a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the position of the first occurrence of any of the within the search scope when such character is found outside quotes, or a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the end of the search scope if such character is not found outside quotes.
If is false, then a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the position of the first occurrence of any of the within the search scope when such character is found outside quotes, or null if such character is not found outside quotes.
NOTE that whether the encountered keychar is inclueded in the returned substring depends on , and will be returned if the length of the substring is 0.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.ReadTo(System.Char[],System.Char[],System.Char[],System.Int32@,System.Text.StringReader.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Advances the reader and reads until any character specified in is encountered outside quotes. The reader's position after executing this method depends on the .
member.param: The reader stops when any of these characters is encountered.

An array of Unicode characters as the left quotes. A left quote of an index of this array corresponds to the right quote of that index of the array specified by . The reader will not stop when any of the is encountered inside a pair of quotes.

An array of Unicode characters as the right quotes. A right quote of an index of this array corresponds to the left quote of that index of the array specified by . The reader will not stop when any of the is encountered inside a pair of quotes.
Returns the index of the encountered keychar in the .
Specifies the reading options.
member.returns:
If ReadeOptions.ReadToEnd is specified in , then a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the position of the first occurrence of any of the within the search scope when such character is found outside quotes, or a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the end of the search scope if such character is not found outside quotes.
If ReadeOptions.ReadToEnd is not specified, then a substring starting from the current position of the reading scope to the position of the first occurrence of any of the within the search scope when such character is found outside quotes, or null if such character is not found outside quotes.
The position of this reader after executing this method depends on if ReadOptions.StopAfterKey is specified. If ReadOptions.StopAfterKey is specified, then the character satisfying the is included in the returned substring if ReadOptions.DiscardKey is also selected.
NOTE that the white spaces at the beginning of the substring will be trimmed if ReadeOptions.TrimStart is specified, and the white spaces at the end of the substring will be trimmed if ReadeOptions.TrimEnd is specified. Also NOTE that will be returned if the length of the substring after trim is 0.

An array of Unicode characters as the left quotes. A left quote of an index of this array corresponds to the right quote of that index of the array specified by . The reader will not stop when a key char is encountered inside a pair of quotes.

An array of Unicode characters as the right quotes. A right quote of an index of this array corresponds to the left quote of that index of the array specified by . The reader will not stop when a key char is encountered inside a pair of quotes.
Specifies the reading options.
member.returns:
If ReadeOptions.ReadToEnd is specified in , then a new reader will be returned encapsulating either a substring starting from the current position of the underlying string instance to the position of the first character satisfying the within the search scope when such character is found, or a substring starting from the current position of the underlying string instance to the end of the search scope if such character is not found.
If ReadeOptions.ReadToEnd is not specified, then a new reader will be returned encapsulating a substring starting from the current position of the underlying string instance to the position of the first character satisfying the within the search scope. When such character cannot be found, a null reference will be returned.
The position of this reader after executing this method depends on if ReadOptions.StopAfterKey is specified. If ReadOptions.StopAfterKey is specified, then the character satisfying the is included in the returned new reader if ReadOptions.DiscardKey is also selected.
NOTE that the white spaces at the beginning of the substring will be trimmed if ReadeOptions.TrimStart is specified, and the white spaces at the end of the substring will be trimmed if ReadeOptions.TrimEnd is specified. Also NOTE that will be returned if the length of the substring after trim is 0.

An array of Unicode characters as the right quotes. A right quote of an index of this array corresponds to the left quote of that index of the array specified by . The reader will not stop when a key char is encountered inside a pair of quotes.
true if the reader should read to the end of the reading scope if no character satisfying the is found; otherwise, false.
member.returns:
If is true, then a new reader will be returned encapsulating either a substring starting from the current position of the underlying string instance to the position of the first character satisfying the within the search scope when such character is found, or a substring starting from the current position of the underlying string instance to the end of the search scope if such character is not found.
If is false, then a new reader will be returned encapsulating a substring starting from the current position of the underlying string instance to the position of the first character satisfying the within the search scope when such character is found. When such character cannot be found, a null reference will be returned.
NOTE that the white spaces at both ends of the substring will be trimmed. Also will be returned if the length of the substring after trim is 0.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.ReadToAsReader(System.Func{System.Char,System.Boolean},System.Char,System.Char,System.Char,System.Char,System.Text.StringReader.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Advances the reader and reads until a character satisfying the specified (key char) is encountered outside quotes. The reader's position after executing this method depends on the .
member.param: A method to test each character of the reading scope and determines whether it is a key char. The reader will not stop when a key char is encountered inside a pair of primary/secondary quotes.
Specifies the Unicode character as the primary left quote.
Specifies the Unicode character as the primary right quote.
Specifies the Unicode character as the secondary left quote. Secondary quotes are escaped when they are inside a pair of primary quotes.
Specifies the Unicode character as the secondary right quote. Secondary quotes are escaped when they are inside a pair of primary quotes.
Specifies the reading options.
member.returns: A new string reader that encapsulates a substring read from the underlying string instance of the current reader.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.RemoveMatchedEnds(System.Char,System.Char,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If the first character (the first non-whitespace character if is true) of the reading scope equals and the last character (the last non-whitespace character if is true) of the reading scope equals , then they are removed from the reading scope.
member.param: The character to match against the first character of the reading scope.
The character to match against the last character of the reading scope.

true if white spaces at both ends of the reading scope will be trimmed before trying to match characters; otherwise, false. NOTE that if this argument is set true, the white spaces will be trimmed even if the first character and the last character of the trimmed reading scope are not matched.
member.returns: true if the first character (the first non-whitespace character if is true) of the reading scope equals and the last character (the last non-whitespace character if is true) of the reading scope equals ; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.RemoveBrackets(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the first character and the last character of the reading scope if they are matched brackets. Matched brackets include '[' and ']', '(' and ')', '{' and '}', '<' and '>'.
member.param: true if white spaces at both ends of the reading scope will be trimmed before trying to find matched characters; otherwise, false. NOTE that if this argument is set true, the white spaces will be trimmed even if the first character and the last character of the trimmed reading scope are not matched brackets.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.RemoveBracketsAndQuotes(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the first character and the last character of the reading scope if they are matched quotes and brackets. Matched quotes and brackets include a pair of single-quotes ('''), a pair of double-quotes ('"'), '[' and ']', '(' and ')', '{' and '}', '<' and '>'.
member.param: true if white spaces at both ends of the reading scope will be trimmed before trying to find matched characters; otherwise, false. NOTE that if this argument is set true, the white spaces will be trimmed even if the first character and the last character of the trimmed reading scope are not matched quotes and brackets.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.RemoveQuotes(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the first character and the last character of the reading scope if they are matched quotes. Matched quotes include a pair of single-quotes ('''), a pair of double-quotes ('"').
member.param: true if white spaces at both ends of the reading scope will be trimmed before trying to find matched characters; otherwise, false. NOTE that if this argument is set true, the white spaces will be trimmed even if the first character and the last character of the trimmed reading scope are not matched quotes.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.RemoveSquareBrackets(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the first character and the last character of the reading scope if they are a pair of square brackets ('[' and ']').

NOTE that if this argument is set true, the white spaces will be trimmed even if the first character and the last character of the trimmed reading scope are not a pair of square brackets.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.RemoveAngleBrackets(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the first character and the last character of the reading scope if they are a pair of angle brackets ('<' and '>').

NOTE that if this argument is set true, the white spaces will be trimmed even if the first character and the last character of the trimmed reading scope are not a pair of angle brackets.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.RemoveRoundBrackets(System.Boolean)

member.name: M:System.Text.StringReader.RemoveBraces(System.Boolean)

member.summary: Advances the reader until a character satisfying is encountered.
